page.title: 05Clifton Wharf
page.content: The disused railway line has been turned into a nature reserve.There is a weight restriction on lorries coming through the village on their way to the motorways and A5. By the side of the North Oxford Canal is a canal wharf.Boats can be hired or repaired at this wharf. Account by Hannah Brown. "Yesterday I went to the Clifton Wharf.We went to look at the things in the shop and also the "Buckby can"(fresh water container)and dipper(scoop),on the table outside.I saw castles and roses on the utensils.Then we went and saw a narrow boat.It was very pretty.When we went inside,there were little cupboards.We came out and sat on the grass looking for a four-leafed clover.After an iced lolly, we went back to school."
